content: "http://www.pbn.com/detail/41916.html" Mass. House OKs sales tax hike to 6.25% Patrick threatens veto; Senate leaders refuse to show cards BOSTON — The Mass. House of Representatives voted by a veto-proof margin late Monday night to raise the state’s sales tax this summer by a fourth, from 5 percent to 6.25 percent, as the Bay State struggles to balance its budget. The 108-to-51 vote sets up a showdown between the overwhelmingly Democratic House and Mass. Gov. Deval L. Patrick, also a Democrat, who only hours before the vote threatened to veto any sales tax increase that was not accompanied by other budget reforms he has proposed, The Boston Globe reported this morning news reported it a late night 11:00 PM vote to get it passed The don't call it TAXACHUSETTS for nothing

title: Mass. House OKs sales tax hike to 6.25%

content: quote: Originally posted by Kegler300: Still less than North Carolina...so is the gas tax. Less than it is here, too. 6.25% isn't bad, even with cities adding their own 1-2% on top of that. Don't know what their income tax rates are, though. Hell, I'd be for dumping income tax entirely and replacing it with sales and excise taxes.
quote: Originally posted by Kegler300: Still less than North Carolina...so is the gas tax.
reply: Less than it is here, too. 6.25% isn't bad, even with cities adding their own 1-2% on top of that. Don't know what their income tax rates are, though. Hell, I'd be for dumping income tax entirely and replacing it with sales and excise taxes.
title: Mass. House OKs sales tax hike to 6.25%
